AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in detecting illegal entry and smuggling, with agents having experience in evaluating circumstances related to reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court responsible for reviewing and deciding on motions related to immigration and border patrol cases
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent with nearly seven years of experience, including a year and a half stationed at the Freer immigration checkpoint, familiar with local vehicles and recognizing approximately 90-95% of them as belonging to farmers and oil field workers in the Farm-to-Market Road 2050 area
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint: checkpoint on Highway 59 that smugglers try to avoid by using alternative routes, where United States Border Patrol agents are stationed
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road used by smugglers to circumvent checkpoints on Highway 59 and U.S. 359, with a recent surge in drop-offs where illegal aliens are picked up by vehicles heading north
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: highway near the location of the traffic stop, providing access to major highways going north
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 59: highway with a checkpoint that smugglers attempt to bypass by using alternative routes such as 'the loop'
